### Liz Cedillo-Pereira

##### Assistant City Manager

Dallas City Hall

1500 Marilla St.

Room 4CN
Dallas, Texas 75201

Main Phone

(214) 670-3390

### Liz Cedillo-Pereira

##### Assistant City Manager

Liz Cedillo-Pereira provides executive leadership to the Dallas Public Library, Office of Arts & Culture, Office of Community Care & Empowerment, Office of Environmental Quality & Sustainability, Office of Equity & Inclusion, Park $ Recreation and Ethics.

* #### Josie Mendoza

  [Email](mailto:josephine.mendoza@dallas.gov)

  ##### (214) 670-3390
* #### Maria Isabele Camacho Cazarez

  [Email](mailto:mariai.ccazares@dallas.gov)

  ##### 214-671-8440

Liz Cedillo-Pereira currently serves as the Assistant City Manager for the City of Dallas, where she utilizes her extensive background in law and public policy to lead critical city initiatives. In her role, Liz oversees several key departments within the City’s Vibrant portfolio including Dallas Public Library Services, the Office of Arts and Culture, the Office of Community Care, the Office of Environmental Quality and Sustainability, and the Office of Equity and Inclusion. She also acts as a liaison to the Park and Recreation Department and provides executive leadership within the City Manager's Office Ethics division.

Before her tenure in public service, Liz was a practicing attorney specializing in Immigration and Nationality Law. In 2015, she was appointed as the Senior Immigration Advisor at the U.S. Department of Homeland Security, Immigration and Customs in Washington, D.C. There, she managed immigration matters, traveled on behalf of the agency, contributed to policy development, and stablished the agency's first Office of Community Engagement across 26 offices nationwide.

In 2017, Liz joined the City of Dallas management team, where she has played a pivotal role in founding the Office of Welcoming Communities & Immigrant Affairs and leading the integrated Office of Equity & Inclusion as Chief of Equity and Inclusion. Her efforts have focused on reimagining city services through innovation and impact.

A Dallas native, Liz is an alumna of North Dallas High School and the first woman in her family to attend college. She graduated from the University of Pennsylvania, where she was recognized as the Woman of Color of the Class of 1993, and from SMU Dedman School of Law, where she received the prestigious Kennedy Award. Liz is married to Oscar Pereira, an aeronautical engineer, and they have three children. She is an active member of several organizations, including Hispanic100, Dallas Summit, Dallas Assembly, and the boards of SMU Dedman School of Law, Welcoming America, and the ThanksGiving Foundation. Liz has received numerous professional awards throughout her career.

* Dallas Hispanic Bar Association “La Luz” Award, 2019
* Louise Raggio Women’s Legal Advocate Award, 2019
* Immigrant Advocate of the Year – Journey Awards, 2019
* National Council of Jewish Women Pioneering Partner Award, 2019
* Texas Trailblazer Hispanic Women of Texas, 2018
* SMU Dedman School of Law Distinguished Alumni Award, 2018
* Ohtli – Republic of Mexico, 2018
* Maura Award – Texas Women’s Foundation, 2014
